EmailTemplate.name: 401k Contributions (1342542398.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: 401k Contributions (1342542398.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly: - - - Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE MicrosoftInternetExplorer4 Hi Jeff, I looked into the 401K matching that we were discussing and I wanted to provide you with a written explanation of how it works. The “Business Center Match” is calculated on an annualized basis, so the personal deferral can be changed at any time (as you just made the change from 10% to 0%), but deductions will continue to be made to uphold your original commitment to your total match. Your original 10% personal deferral election maxed out your business center match- take a look below: Personal Deferral- 10%Match (5x’s Personal Deferral up to 6%) so 5x6%=30% Business Center Match Contributions are equal to 6% of your annual Gross Pay X 5, with a maximum possible Business Center Match Contribution of 5 times your Personal Deferral. I suggest we look at your last payroll (7/13) to review how it will affect contributions for the rest of the year. Your current year-to-date Personal Deferral is $1,091.49, and you have decided to make no more personal contributions for the remainder of the year. This establishes a maximum Business Center Match of $5,457.45, which is 5 times your Personal Deferral. Here is a snapshot of your retirement contributions as of Friday 7/13/12 Gross Pay$10,914.92 Personal Deferral$1,091.49 Business Center Match$3,274.47 Total Retirement$4,365.96 Note that 6% of your Gross pay is $654.895. Take this number times 5 and you arrive at current Business Center Match of $3,274.47. Based on this, you have not yet reached the maximum Business Center Match contribution threshold of $5,457.45. As a result, each subsequent payroll Business Center Match Contributions will continue to be deducted as your Gross pay goes up until you hit $5,457.45. Business Center Match Contributions will continue to be made until your gross pay reaches $18,190.00 when this occurs your contributions will look like this: Gross Pay$18,190.00 Personal Deferral$1,091.49 Business Center Match$5,457.45 Total Retirement$6,548.94 At this point your personal deferral will be 6% of your year-to-date Gross Pay, and your Business Center Contributions will be 5 times your Personal Deferral. No more Business Center Contributions will be made past $5,457.95 (provided you do not change your Personal Deferral.) I hope this explanation helps. Please don’t hesitate to let me know if you need more clarification. Best,Sara___________________________________ SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://www.mbopartners.com/> Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com <mailto:postmaster@mbopartners.com> and permanently delete the e-mail and files.
